title: Volkswagen Arena - Wikipedia
snippet: Volkswagen Arena (German pronunciation: [ˈfɔlksvaːɡn̩ ʔaˌʁeːnaː]; also known as the VfL Wolfsburg Arena due to UEFA sponsorship regulations) is a football stadium in the German city of Wolfsburg, Lower Saxony. It was opened in 2002 and named after the automotive group Volkswagen AG.

title: Stadium | Volkswagen Arena and AOK Stadion | VfL Wolfsburg
snippet: In order to match the club’s ... VfL Ladies’ reserve team games, among others - no longer met the club’s requirements and, in 2002, the Volkswagen Arena became the Wolves’ new home....

title: Volkswagen Arena: a modern stadium in the heart of Wolfsburg
snippet: The Volkswagen Arena in Wolfsburg has been the home stadium of VfL Wolfsburg since 2002. The Arena, located in the Allerpark, has a capacity of 35,000 spectators. In addition to soccer matches, the Volkswagen Arena is also a venue for concerts and other events.

title: VfL Wolfsburg - Wikipedia
snippet: Wolfsburg plays at the Volkswagen Arena, a multi-purpose stadium which seats a total capacity of 30,000 spectators. Before construction was finished in 2002, Wolfsburg played their home games at the 21,600 capacity VfL-Stadium.
